alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 5:03AM AKST until December 21 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON FOR THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 70 mph. Visibility may drop as low as one quarter mile or less at times due to resuspension of snow that has already fallen. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...From late tonight through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A winter storm is expected to bring 3 to 6 inches of snow to Thompson Pass Monday afternoon through Monday night. As the storm moves east of the region, strong northeasterly winds will develop as colder air works in from the interior. These winds will likely cause resuspension of transportable snow, with the potential to produce blizzard conditions at times through the first half of Tuesday. Wind gusts to 50 mph are also expected through Keystone Canyon and across Valdez. Blowing snow due to these winds may reduce visibility to as low as one half mile or less at times.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means there is a potential for falling and/or blowing snow with strong winds and extremely poor visibilities. This can lead to whiteout conditions and make travel very hazardous.
